InfoDescription: DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on and manage agreements.

ManagerActions.Description: You can see this because you have admin permissions

OfferLetter.Title: A Candidate offer letter
OfferLetter.Description: This action demonstrates the following DocuSign features:
OfferLetter.CodeFlow:
Code flow:
Step 1

When the button is selected, we ask the user to provide a name and email address for the candidate. The information will be used to fill in a placeholder recipient that is in the template. We then call the Templates:list method on the account to check if a template exists. If it does, we find the templateId; if not, we call the Templates:Create method to create a new template with the required fields and documents and a single placeholder recipient.

Step 2

We proceed to create an envelope from the template by using the Envelopes:create method, providing the logged-in user's email address and name for the recipient.

Step 3

We make an API call to the EnvelopeViews:createRecipient method with a redirectUri back into the app. We redirect the browser to go to the URL that we get back from the aforementioned API call. At this point the manager, who is the first recipient (routing order 1), signs the document. Once the manager finishes signing the document, an email will be sent to the candidate for remote signing (routing order 2).

I9Request.Title: An I-9 verification request
I9Request.Description: This action demonstrates the following DocuSign features:
I9Request.CodeFlow:
Code flow:
Step 1

When the button is selected, we ask the user to provide a name and email address for the new employee. The information will be used to fill in a placeholder recipient that is in the template. We then call the Templates:list method on the account to check if a template exists. If it does, we find the templateId; if not, we call the Templates:Create method to create a new template with the required fields and documents and a single placeholder recipient.

Step 2

We proceed to create an envelope from the template by using the Envelopes:create method, providing the logged-in user's email address and name for the recipient. The envelope is created and immidiately sent out for remote signing by the single recipient. The recipient recieves an email that includes instructions for how to proceed with the IDV process and eventually sign the document.

DirectDeposit.Title: Direct deposit information
DirectDeposit.Description: This action demonstrates the following DocuSign features:
DirectDeposit.CodeFlow:
Code flow:
Step 1

When the button is selected, we call the Templates:list method on the account to check if a template exists. If it does, we find the templateId; if not, we call the Templates:Create method to create a new template with the required fields and documents and a single placeholder recipient.

Step 2

We proceed to create an envelope from the template by using the Envelopes:create method, providing the logged-in user's email address and name for the recipient.

Step 3

We make an API call to the EnvelopeViews:createRecipient method with a redirectUri back into the app. We redirect the browser to go to the URL that we get back from the aforementioned API call.

Step 4

After signing is complete, we make another call to the Envelopes:get method to retrieve the information from the envelope.

W4TaxWithholding.Title: W-4 tax withholding Relevant for USA only
W4TaxWithholding.Description: This action demonstrates the following DocuSign API functions:
W4TaxWithholding.CodeFlow:
Code flow:
Step 1

When the button is selected, we call the Templates:list method on the account to check if a template exists. If it does, we find the templateId; if not, we call the Templates:Create method to create a new template with the required fields and documents and a single placeholder recipient.

Step 2

We proceed to create an envelope from the template by using the Envelopes:create method, providing the logged-in user's email address and name for the recipient.

Step 3

We make an API call to the EnvelopeViews:createRecipient method with a redirectUri back into the app. We redirect the browser to go to the URL that we get back from the aforementioned API call.

TimeCard.Title: Time Card
TimeCard.Description: This action demonstrates the following DocuSign features:
TimeCard.FunctionsList:
• Create a custom clickwrap
  • Activate a clickwrap
  • Display a modal clickwrap
TimeCard.CodeFlow:
Code flow:
Step 1

When the form is submitted, we use the Envelopes: create method to send the signature request with the corresponding form information. The envelope we construct contains a document object, a recipient object of type signer, and tabs, which contain the form fields information. Since we are using embedded signing, we must also set the clientUserId property on the recipient.

We place the tabs on the document by specifying a SignHereTab element and a PaymentTab element as part of the signer element. The tab elements are positioned using x/y coordinates on the document.

The PaymentTab serves two purposes. It is used both to display the amount due in the document and to instruct DocuSign to proceed to collect payments after the document is signed.

Lastly, we include the status "sent" in the request so that the envelope is sent for signing. The eSignature REST API request is sent to the following endpoint:

POST /v2.1/accounts/{accountId}/envelopes
Step 2

To enable embedded signing of the envelope inside our application, we next use the EnvelopeViews: createRecipient method to generate a signing URL for the recipient. For this to work, the clientUserId property must be set on the recipient when the envelope is sent during step 1 above.

Once the envelope is sent, we save the envelope ID and recipient information to our session. Then, we retrieve the envelope ID and recipient info from our session and create the recipient view by generating the URL and displaying the recipient view in a full-width and full-height iframe inside our page.

To create the recipient view of the envelope, we send an API request to:

POST /v2.1/accounts/{accountId}/envelopes/{envelopeId}/views/recipient

When the button is selected, we call the Templates:list method on the account to check if a template exists. If it does, we find the templateId; if not, we call the Templates:Create method to create a new template with the required fields and documents and a single placeholder recipient.
